blocks.heading: Our IKEA Sleep Coach
blocks.subheading: Get ready for drift off with our very own tips for a Wonderful Everynight

items.heading: Coach Tip 1:
items.text: Warm up to wind down. Try a hot bath before you hit the hay.

items.heading: Coach Tip 2:
items.text: Potassium helps you sleep through the night. So break out a banana before bed.

items.heading: Coach Tip 3:
items.text: The blue light from your phone reduces the hormone that helps you sleep. Drop that mobile and give me 40 winks.

items.heading: Coach Tip 4:
items.text: Being too cold or too hot can wake you in the night. Match your duvet to the season; bulk up for winter, slim down for summer.
items.tweet: Overheating? Too cold? Set your duvet weight for the season - bulk up for winter, slim down for summer.

items.heading: Coach Tip 5:
items.text: Earn yourself a 5 minute lie in. Prep your outfit the night before.

items.heading: Coach Tip 6:
items.text: Foam or sprung? Find the right mattress for you, so an achy back won’t throw you off your sleep game.

items.heading: Coach Tip 7:
items.text: Rotate to the right temperature if you want a comfortable night’s sleep. 18-22°C is a winner.

items.heading: Coach Tip 8:
items.text: Reading helps you switch off from your day. So relax and give me ten more pages.

items.heading: Coach Tip 9:
items.text: Caffeine can throw your sleep rhythm, so after 2pm swap regular tea for decaf or chamomile. Lift and sip and lift and sip...
items.tweet: Caffeine can throw your sleep rhythm, so after 2pm swap in some decaf or chamomile. Lift and sip and lift and...

items.heading: Coach Tip 10:
items.text: Get your head in the zone with the right pillow, that way you won't wake up with a deep burn in your neck.
